Package hw1

Class RichArray

java.lang.Object
hw1.RichArray
public class RichArray extends Object
This class provides functionality for manipulating and transforming 2D arrays. It has constructors for both 1D and 2D arrays, allowing the creating of RichArray objects from existing normal arrays. The class includes methods for reversing, rotating, transposing, raveling and unraveling. Additionally, there are methods for joining and stacking arrays, slicing a portion of the array, and replacing a portion of the array with another array.
Since:
15/02/24
Version:
1.0
Author:
Panagiotis Tsembekis

  • Constructor Details

    • RichArray

      public RichArray(int[] array)
      Constructs a RichArray object from a 1D array.
      Parameters:
      array - The 1D array to be used in the RichArray object.

    • RichArray

      public RichArray(int[][] array)
      Constructs a RichArray object from a 2D array.
      Parameters:
      array - The 2D array to be used in the RichArray object.

  • Method Details

    • reverse

      public RichArray reverse()
      Reverses the elements of the RichArray horizontally. This method creates and returns new RichArray with the same dimensions as the original, where the elements in each row are reversed.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray with reversed elements.

    • rotateRight

      public RichArray rotateRight()
      Rotates the RichArray 90 degrees to the right. This method creates and returns a new RichArray object with dimensions swapped, where each element is rotated 90 degrees clockwise from its original position.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray rotated 90 degrees to the right.

    • rotateLeft

      public RichArray rotateLeft()
      Rotates the RichArray 90 degrees to the left. This method creates and returns a new RichArray with dimensions swapped, where each element is rotated 90 degrees counterclockwise from its original position.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray rotated 90 degrees to the left.

    • transpose

      public RichArray transpose()
      Transposes the RichArray. This method creates and returns a new RichArray where the rows become columns and vice versa.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray transposed.

    • ravel

      public RichArray ravel(int n)
      Ravel the RichArray into a new array with a specified width. This method creates and returns a new RichArray by flattening the original array into a 1D array with a specified width.
      Parameters:
      n - The width of the new array.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray raveled with the specified width.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array's column value is not exactly divisible by the given n value or if n is not greater than 0.

    • unravel

      public RichArray unravel()
      Unravel the RichArray into a flat 1D array. This method creates and returns a new RichArray by converting the original 2D array into a single-row 1D array.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray unraveled into a flat 1D array.

    • reshape

      public RichArray reshape(int n)
      Reshapes the 2D array into a new RichArray with the specified number of columns (n), adjusting the number of rows accordingly. If the total number of elements in the original array (r*c) is not exactly divisible by n, or if n is 0, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of columns for the reshaped array.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray representing the reshaped array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If r*c is not exactly divisible by n, or if n is not greater than 0.

    • join

      public RichArray join(RichArray array)
      Join the original RichArray with given RichArray horizontally. This method creates and returns a new RichArray by horizontally concatenating the elements of the original array with the elements of another RichArray. The arrays must have the same number of rows for successful joining.
      Parameters:
      array - The RichArray to join with.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray resulting from the horizontal concatenation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the arrays have a different number of rows

    • stack

      public RichArray stack(RichArray array)
      Stack the RichArray on top of another RichArray vertically. This method creates and returns a new RichArray by vertically stacking the elements of the original array on top of the elements of another RichArray. The arrays must have the same number of columns for successful stacking.
      Parameters:
      array - The RichArray to stack on top.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray resulting from the vertical stacking.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the arrays have a different number of columns or if given RichArray is null

    • slice

      public RichArray slice(int firstRow, int lastRow, int firstColumn, int lastColumn)
      Create a new RichArray by slicing a portion of the original array. This method creates and returns a new RichArray by selecting a rectangular portion of the original array specified by the provided row and column indices.
      Parameters:
      firstRow - The index of the first row in the slice (inclusive).
      lastRow - The index of the last row in the slice (inclusive).
      firstColumn - The index of the first column in the slice (inclusive).
      lastColumn - The index of the last column in the slice (inclusive).
      Returns:
      A new RichArray representing the sliced portion of the original array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the given row/column values are out of array's bounds.

    • checkValuesSlice

      public boolean checkValuesSlice(int firstRow, int lastRow, int firstColumn, int lastColumn)
      Helper method for slice(int,int,int,int). Checks if the specified values are valid for array indices.
      Parameters:
      firstRow - The index of the first row in the slice (inclusive).
      lastRow - The index of the last row in the slice (inclusive).
      firstColumn - The index of the first column in the slice (inclusive).
      lastColumn - The index of the last column in the slice (inclusive).
      Returns:
      True if values are non-negative and within the bounds of the array, false otherwise.

    • replace

      public RichArray replace(RichArray array, int row, int column)
      Create a new RichArray by replacing a portion of the original array with another array. This method creates and returns a new RichArray by replacing a rectangular portion of the original array with the elements of another RichArray. The replacement starts at the specified row and column indices.
      Parameters:
      array - The RichArray to use for replacement.
      row - The starting row index for replacement.
      column - The starting column index for replacement.
      Returns:
      A new RichArray with the specified portion replaced by the given array.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the replacement goes out of bounds and if given RichArray is null

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Converts the 2D array into a formatted string representation. This method iterates through each element in the 2D array and constructs a string representation by concatenating the elements with spaces between them and newline characters at the end of each row.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A formatted string representing the 2D array.
